findings.title: Malicious libraries
findings.description: The audit report indicates the presence of malicious libraries in the smart contract.

findings.title: Compiler version not fixed
findings.description: The compiler version used to compile the contract is not fixed, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unchecked external call
findings.description: Updating state variables after making an external call violates the Check_Effects_Interaction Pattern and can lead to a potential re-entrancy scenario.

findings.title: Unchecked math
findings.description: Performing multiplication on the result of a division without proper method can cause precision loss.

findings.title: Implicit visibility level
findings.description: The following elements in the contract have not been assigned any visibility keyword explicitly, which can lead to ambiguity.

findings.title: _getWithdrawPercent function performs a multiplication on the result of a Division
findings.description: The _getWithdrawPercent function performs a multiplication operation on the result of an integer division, which may lead to precision loss due to truncation.

findings.title: Integer Divisions in Solidity might truncate
findings.description: During the automated testing of the Root.sol contract, it was found that the _getWithdrawPercent function performs a multiplication on the result of a Division. Integer Divisions in Solidity might truncate.

findings.title: Redundant Variable Initialization
findings.description: The _getWithdrawPercent() function initializes a local variable _deployTime with the already available state variable deployTime, which can be used directly in computations.
